questions.question: I had the required qualifications but I ………………………………… get the job anyhow.
questions.description: When the verb in one coordinate clause is in the past tense, the verb in the other coordinate clause is also likely to be in the past tense.

questions.question: The higher we climbed, the colder we …………………………….
questions.description: The same tense is used in both clauses in this construction.

questions.question: She has never …………………………….. to anybody.
questions.description: Use the past participle after has/have/had.

questions.question: I ………………………….. to wait.
questions.description: The passive verb is required here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: Playing computer games for hours on end ……………………………. not a good idea.
questions.description: Here the subject is the ing form playing ing forms are treated as singular.

questions.question: ………………………….. fast, I was able to catch up with him.
questions.description: When both clauses have the same subject, it is sometimes possible to connect them with a present participle.

questions.question: They disqualified her for ……………………………….. late to the finals.
He was a dissolute young man who ………………………………….. only of his own pleasure.
If enough members ………………………., the new bill won’t be approved.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: His complete disregard of others ……………………………. him the respect of his friends.
